Almost every train going to Sochi from other Russian cities has a last stop in Adler. The railroad station is located a bit aside from the center.
A commuter line is running every half an hour from Sochi station and the trip takes about 30 minutes.

There are buses running from about 07 AM to about 10 PM.
Bus 125 and 124 take from Sochi railroad station to Adler center. The trip usually takes about 40 minutes but due to traffic it can be as long as 2 hours. The bus costs 48-50 RUR.
Sochi airport is located in Adler. You can take several buses to get from there:

105, 124 - from the airport to the railroad station (can take also to kurortny gorodok).

, departing to Sochi railroad station every hour and has a stop at Adler station as well. But the price for a short trip (9 mins) is quite high (200 RUR), so it is recommended to use buses.
Also you could take a taxi, but it is necessary to have it booked beforehand as the prices in the airport will be inadequately high.

The town has a lot of places to stay, but most of the Russian people coming to stay in summer usually rent a room in a private housholds (chastnye) because the price will be much lower. Since wouldn't most likely speak English, it will be hard to find English speaking household. Most of the private households will include a separate room with shared bathroom and WC, sometimes outside.

Kurort in Russian is Resort and it's called because of the resorts complex located in the area. It is in midway from Sochi center and Adler center. Distance to the airport is 3 km, Adler railroad station - 1 km, to Sochi center is 20 km.

The heart of the Kurortny gorodok is resort complex which consists of several resorts - Delfin, Koral, Fregat, Neptun and Smena etc. There are some renovated hotels like Oasis and Golden Dolphin, and some other small private mini-hotels.

The coast side has a lot of cafes, restaurants, shops and other venues for entertainment, like dolphinarium, aquarium, aquapark, some night clubs, bowling etc.
Cost of stay can be considerably higher than in other areas in Adler.
